query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
1 Contra miglior voler voler mal pugna; 2 onde contra ’l piacer mio, per piacerli, 3 trassi de l’acqua non sazia la spugna.
query.error: **English:** 1 Against a better will, an evil will struggles; 2 therefore against my own pleasure, to please him, 3 I drew from the water the sponge not yet satisfied.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
4 Mossimi; e ’l duca mio si mosse per li 5 luoghi spediti pur lungo la roccia, 6 come si va per muro stretto a’ merli;
query.error: **English:** 4 I moved on; and my leader moved along with me 5 through the unencumbered places, right along the rock, 6 as one goes along a narrow wall at the battlements;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
7 ché la gente che fonde a goccia a goccia 8 per li occhi il mal che tutto ’l mondo occupa, 9 da l’altra parte in fuor troppo s’approccia.
query.error: **English:** 7 for the people who pour drop by drop 8 through their eyes the evil that infects the whole world 9 approach too closely on the other side.
query.result: 7 rag an gent hag fond a goka a goka 8 rag an oki an drok oll an bys okupya, 9 dhe an dalla parti yn fuor trobo s'aprochya.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
10 Maladetta sie tu, antica lupa, 11 che più che tutte l’altre bestie hai preda 12 per la tua fame sanza fine cupa!
query.error: **English:** 10 Accursed be you, ancient she-wolf, 11 who more than all other beasts are ravenous 12 for your insatiable hunger!
query.result: 10 Malledhys vy, an gwrach koth, 11 moy es oll an bestes erel vyth preda 12 rag an agas heb fin kewas dowr!

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
13 O ciel, nel cui girar par che si creda 14 le condizion di qua giù trasmutarsi, 15 quando verrà per cui questa disceda?
query.error: **English:** 13 O heavens, in whose revolutions it seems to be believed 14 that the conditions down here change, 15 when will he come for whom this she-wolf will depart?
query.result: 13 O nef, yn aga drohevel syw parsys creda 14 an kechyow a-woles y'n treylya yma, 15 pyw vyth dhevedh rag an onan ma ythoma?

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
16 Noi andavam con passi lenti e scarsi, 17 e io attento a l’ombre, ch’i’ sentia 18 pietosamente piangere e lagnarsi;
query.error: **English:** 16 We were walking with slow and weary steps, 17 and I was paying attention to the shades, whom I heard 18 weeping and lamenting pitifully;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
19 e per ventura udi’ «Dolce Maria!» 20 dinanzi a noi chiamar così nel pianto 21 come fa donna che in parturir sia;
query.error: **English:** 19 and by chance I heard "Sweet Mary!" 20 being called out before us in the weeping 21 as a woman does when she is in labor;
query.result: 19 ha rag gwella'th y klevyas "Dowr Vari!" 20 owth dhevedhes ragdhon ni yn an kewyna 21 dell yw gwres gwragh pan yw yn parturi.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
22 e seguitar: «Povera fosti tanto, 23 quanto veder si può per quello ospizio 24 dove sponesti il tuo portato santo».
query.error: **English:** 22 and then: "You were so poor, 23 as can be seen from that inn 24 where you gave birth to your holy burden."
query.result: 22 Ha owth sevel: "Bogh vythsa kemmys, 23 dell yw gweles rag an osbys honan 24 le mayth vyth sponyes an agas purtas sans."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
25 Seguentemente intesi: «O buon Fabrizio, 26 con povertà volesti anzi virtute 27 che gran ricchezza posseder con vizio».
query.error: **English:** 25 Then I heard: "O good Fabricius, 26 with poverty you preferred virtue 27 to possessing great wealth with vice."
query.result: 25 Wosa henna klevyas: "O Fabricius da, 26 gans boghder vyth owth karas rag virtu 27 es possessa golud bras gans vyth."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
28 Queste parole m’eran sì piaciute, 29 ch’io mi trassi oltre per aver contezza 30 di quello spirto onde parean venute.
query.error: **English:** 28 These words were so pleasing to me, 29 that I moved forward to learn more 30 about the spirit from whom they seemed to come.
query.result: 28 An gerow-ma na veu kemmys owth karas, 29 henna owth omdhyskynas rag aga konta 30 a'gan sperys owth paryas owth dos.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
31 Esso parlava ancor de la larghezza 32 che fece Niccolò a le pulcelle, 33 per condurre ad onor lor giovinezza.
query.error: **English:** 31 He was still speaking of the generosity 32 that Nicholas showed to the young women, 33 in order to lead their youth to honor.
query.result: 31 Ev a veu owth kewsel a-dro dhe'gan ledra 32 aga wrug Nikola dhe'gan yowynkyon, 33 rag aga gorra aga yowynkder dhe onor.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
34 «O anima che tanto ben favelle, 35 dimmi chi fosti», dissi, «e perché sola 36 tu queste degne lode rinovelle.
query.error: **English:** 34 "O soul who speaks so well, 35 tell me who you were," I said, "and why you alone 36 renew these worthy praises.
query.result: 34 "O eneval owth kewsel kemmys da, 35 dywedh vyth pyw vythsa," me a leveris, "ha hwyrrag vyth onan 36 owth adnowa an molenow-ma owth karas.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
37 Non fia sanza mercé la tua parola, 38 s’io ritorno a compiér lo cammin corto 39 di quella vita ch’al termine vola».
query.error: **English:** 37 Your words will not be without reward, 38 if I return to complete the short journey 39 of that life which is flying towards its end.
query.result: 37 Na vyth heb marsowth an gerow-ma, 38 mar dyvydh vyth dhe'gan gorra an fordh byghan 39 a'gan bywder owth hedha dhe'gan termen.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
40 Ed elli: «Io ti dirò, non per conforto 41 ch’io attenda di là, ma perché tanta 42 grazia in te luce prima che sie morto.
query.error: **English:** 40 And he: "I will tell you, not for any comfort 41 that I expect from there, but because so much 42 grace shines in you before you are dead.
query.result: 40 Ha henna: "Vy a leverow dhys, na rag marsowth 41 owth attendaf vyth a-dhia, mes rag kemmys 42 gras owth skler yn-tas kyns vyth marow."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
43 Io fui radice de la mala pianta 44 che la terra cristiana tutta aduggia, 45 sì che buon frutto rado se ne schianta.
query.error: **English:** 43 I was the root of the evil plant 44 that overshadows all of Christendom, 45 so that good fruit is rarely harvested from it.
query.result: 43 Vy veu gwreydh a'gan plann drog 44 owth aduj oll an norvys kristyon, 45 henna owth skila kemmys frooth da a-dhiworth.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
46 Ma se Doagio, Lilla, Guanto e Bruggia 47 potesser, tosto ne saria vendetta; 48 e io la cheggio a lui che tutto giuggia.
query.error: **English:** 46 But if Douai, Lille, Ghent and Bruges 47 could, vengeance would soon be taken; 48 and I ask it of Him who judges all.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
49 Chiamato fui di là Ugo Ciappetta; 50 di me son nati i Filippi e i Luigi 51 per cui novellamente è Francia retta.
query.error: **English:** 49 I was called Hugh Capet down there; 50 from me were born the Philips and the Louises 51 by whom France is now ruled.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
52 Figliuol fu’ io d’un beccaio di Parigi: 53 quando li regi antichi venner meno 54 tutti, fuor ch’un renduto in panni bigi,
query.error: **English:** 52 Son of a butcher of Paris was I: 53 when the ancient kings all came to an end, 54 except for one clad in humble gray,
query.result: 52 Mab o gesyk a Baris oen: 53 pan veu an reow koth henna oll 54 marnas onan gwiskes yn glas,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
55 trova’mi stretto ne le mani il freno 56 del governo del regno, e tanta possa 57 di nuovo acquisto, e sì d’amici pieno,
query.error: **English:** 55 I found the reins of government of the kingdom 56 tightly held in my hands, and such great power 57 newly acquired, and so full of friends,
query.result: 55 kavos yn fast yn y dhewlagas 56 lywydh an wlas, ha gallos bras 57 nowydh, ha leun a vynoryon,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
58 ch’a la corona vedova promossa 59 la testa di mio figlio fu, dal quale 60 cominciar di costor le sacrate ossa.
query.error: **English:** 58 that the widowed crown was raised 59 upon the head of my son, from whom 60 began the sacred bones of these men.
query.result: 58 bys dhe'n kurun weddw dhe'n golgh 59 pen y vab, dhyworth pyth 60 dallethaskorrasowennek.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
61 Mentre che la gran dota provenzale 62 al sangue mio non tolse la vergogna, 63 poco valea, ma pur non facea male.
query.error: **English:** 61 While the great dowry from Provence 62 did not remove the shame from my bloodline, 63 it was worth little, but still did no harm.
query.result: 61 Panvrea an brassa dowransoweth 62 dhe'm gwaedh na gavas an wonn, 63 byghan o prys, mes na wrug drok.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
64 Lì cominciò con forza e con menzogna 65 la sua rapina; e poscia, per ammenda, 66 Pontì e Normandia prese e Guascogna.
query.error: **English:** 64 There he began with force and with deceit 65 his plundering; and afterwards, as amends, 66 he seized Ponthieu and Normandy and Gascony.
query.result: 64 Eno deuth ha bos ha goweth 65 y dha ladronieth; ha wosa, rag amendys, 66 Pontì ha Normandi ha Gwaskon a gemeras.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
67 Carlo venne in Italia e, per ammenda, 68 vittima fé di Curradino; e poi 69 ripinse al ciel Tommaso, per ammenda.
query.error: **English:** 67 Charles came to Italy and, as amends, 68 made Conradin his victim; and then 69 he sent Thomas back to heaven, as amends.
query.result: 67 Charles a dheuth dhe Italli, ha, rag amendys, 68 oberas vyctim a Gurradino; ha wosa 69 ev a dhaskyrghas Thomas dhe'n nef, rag amendys.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
70 Tempo vegg’ io, non molto dopo ancoi, 71 che tragge un altro Carlo fuor di Francia, 72 per far conoscer meglio e sé e ’ suoi.
query.error: **English:** 70 I see a time, not long from now, 71 when another Charles comes out of France, 72 to make himself and his followers better known.
query.result: 70 Amser a welaf, nyns yw bell ow pella, 71 pan vo Charles aral dhe Frànk, 72 rag gul wel dhe dhiskwedhes ef ha'y dus.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
73 Sanz’ arme n’esce e solo con la lancia 74 con la qual giostrò Giuda, e quella ponta 75 sì, ch’a Fiorenza fa scoppiar la pancia.
query.error: **English:** 73 He goes forth unarmed and only with the lance 74 with which Judas jousted, and he thrusts it so 75 that he makes Florence burst open at the belly.
query.result: 73 Heb arm n’eus ha onan gans an lans 74 gans pan jotras Judas, ha henna a ponta 75 mar, bys dhe Fiorenza dhe dhalleth an kodha.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
76 Quindi non terra, ma peccato e onta 77 guadagnerà, per sé tanto più grave, 78 quanto più lieve simil danno conta.
query.error: **English:** 76 From this he will gain not land, but sin and shame, 77 which will be all the more serious for him 78 since he counts such harm as slight.
query.result: 76 Wosa henna nyns yw tir, mes pechodh ha gwonn, 77 a dheth bys moyha, rag ef moy ages, 78 vel drok mar byghan yw an drok henna.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
79 L’altro, che già uscì preso di nave, 80 veggio vender sua figlia e patteggiarne 81 come fanno i corsar de l’altre schiave.
query.error: **English:** 79 The other, who once escaped by ship, 80 I see selling his daughter and bargaining for her 81 as pirates do with their other slaves.
query.result: 79 Aral, a wrug onanweth dhe'n les, 80 a welaf ow prenna y vrec’h ha ober marchand 81 mar corsars a wra ober gans aga sklavow erel.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
82 O avarizia, che puoi tu più farne, 83 poscia c’ha’ il mio sangue a te sì tratto, 84 che non si cura de la propria carne?
query.error: **English:** 82 O avarice, what more can you do to us, 83 since you have drawn my blood to you so much 84 that it cares nothing for its own flesh?
query.result: 82 O avaris, pyth a alli thu moy oberi, 83 wosa t’eus ow tynna’m gwaedh dhe’th bys mar, 84 na wra ges kar dhe'y honen korf?

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
85 Perché men paia il mal futuro e ’l fatto, 86 veggio in Alagna intrar lo fiordaliso, 87 e nel vicario suo Cristo esser catto.
query.error: **English:** 85 So that the evil to come and the evil done may seem less to me, 86 I see the fleur-de-lis enter Anagni 87 and Christ being taken prisoner in his vicar.
query.result: 85 Rag an drok dhe dhesi ha’n drok wruthyl, 86 a welaf an flour-de-lis dhe vos dhe Alagna, 87 ha Krist dhe vos kemerys y’n y vycari.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
88 Veggiolo un’altra volta esser deriso; 89 veggio rinovellar l’aceto e ’l fiele, 90 e tra vivi ladroni esser anciso.
query.error: **English:** 88 I see him mocked a second time; 89 I see the vinegar and the gall renewed, 90 and him put to death among living thieves.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
91 Veggio il novo Pilato sì crudele, 92 che ciò nol sazia, ma sanza decreto 93 portar nel Tempio le cupide vele.
query.error: **English:** 91 I see the new Pilate so cruel, 92 that this does not satisfy him, but without decree 93 he carries the greedy sails into the Temple.
query.result: 91 Gwelyn an Pylat nowydh kemmys yw feth, 92 na wra henna dos vyth, mes heb hemma, 93 gorra yn an Templ an hwylyow chwanna.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
94 O Segnor mio, quando sarò io lieto 95 a veder la vendetta che, nascosa, 96 fa dolce l’ira tua nel tuo secreto?
query.error: **English:** 94 O my Lord, when shall I be glad 95 to see the vengeance that, hidden, 96 makes your wrath sweet in your secret?
query.result: 94 O Arluth vy, pyw hedhyw vyf ladh 95 gwelos an dial a wra, cusul, 96 ow kul an growdh dhywgh yn dhywgh cusul?

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
97 Ciò ch’io dicea di quell’ unica sposa 98 de lo Spirito Santo e che ti fece 99 verso me volger per alcuna chiosa,
query.error: **English:** 97 That which I said of that unique bride 98 of the Holy Spirit, and which made you 99 turn to me for some explanation,
query.result: 97 An peth a leveris a'n onan priod 98 a'n Spyrys Sans ha'gas tus 99 troha'm rag onan esbonans,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
100 tanto è risposto a tutte nostre prece 101 quanto ’l dì dura; ma com’ el s’annotta, 102 contrario suon prendemo in quella vece.
query.error: **English:** 100 so much is answered to all our prayers 101 as long as the day lasts; but when night falls, 102 we hear the opposite sound instead.
query.result: 100 kemmys yw gowsys dhe bub oll agan pednans 101 avel an jydh a dhor; mes pan vo nos, 102 son dyffrans a glewomp yn y le.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
103 Noi repetiam Pigmalïon allotta, 104 cui traditore e ladro e paricida 105 fece la voglia sua de l’oro ghiotta;
query.error: **English:** 103 We repeat the story of Pygmalion often, 104 whom his desire for gold, the glutton, 105 made a traitor, a thief and a murderer;
query.result: 103 Ni a wra'n leverel Pygmalion soth, 104 neb an golon a wra'n breus, lader ha mordhryer 105 a wrug dhe'y voth dhe'y awr dhe'n our.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
106 e la miseria de l’avaro Mida, 107 che seguì a la sua dimanda gorda, 108 per la qual sempre convien che si rida.
query.error: **English:** 106 and the misery of the miser Midas, 107 which followed his proud request, 108 for which it is always right to laugh.
query.result: 106 ha mesk an avar Mida, 107 neb a dhe'y dhisyr bras, 108 rag an peth a wra leverys dhe'y gowgh.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
109 Del folle Acàn ciascun poi si ricorda, 110 come furò le spoglie, sì che l’ira 111 di Iosüè qui par ch’ancor lo morda.
query.error: **English:** 109 Everyone remembers the fool Achan, 110 how he stole the spoils, so that the wrath 111 of Joshua here seems still to bite him.
query.result: 109 A'n fol Acàn pub onen a'n kov, 110 pena'gas ladro an spolyow, rag an feth 111 a Josuè ama'n leverel dhe'y voth.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
115 Polinestòr ch’ancise Polidoro; 116 ultimamente ci si grida: “Crasso, 117 dilci, che ’l sai: di che sapore è l’oro?”.
query.error: **English:** 115 Polymnestor who slew Polydorus; 116 Finally one cries out to us: “Crassus, 117 Tell us, for you know: what is the taste of gold?”.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
118 Talor parla l’uno alto e l’altro basso, 119 secondo l’affezion ch’ad ir ci sprona 120 ora a maggiore e ora a minor passo:
query.error: **English:** 118 Sometimes one speaks high and the other low, 119 According to the affection that spurs us to go 120 Now at a greater and now at a lesser pace:
query.result: 118 Unyth a leverir unn ughel ha'n aral isel, 119 Herwydh an affection a spron dhyn dhe mos 120 Unyth moyha ha'n aral moyha byghan:

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
121 però al ben che ’l dì ci si ragiona, 122 dianzi non era io sol; ma qui da presso 123 non alzava la voce altra persona».
query.error: **English:** 121 Therefore, as for the good that is spoken of to us by day, 122 A short while ago I was not alone; but here nearby 123 No other person raised his voice».
query.result: 121 Rag dhe'n daa a leverir dhyn an jydh, 122 Dy dhys o chi nyns oen; mes yma a-ugh 123 Nyns oen aral a leveris y lef».

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
124 Noi eravam partiti già da esso, 125 e brigavam di soverchiar la strada 126 tanto quanto al poder n’era permesso,
query.error: **English:** 124 We had already departed from him, 125 And we were arguing about which way to go, 126 As far as our power permitted us,
query.result: 124 Nyns esa parti owna gensi dhe'n, 125 Ha'n argusas an fordh 126 Kemmys ha'n gallos dhyn a allaas,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
127 quand’ io senti’, come cosa che cada, 128 tremar lo monte; onde mi prese un gelo 129 qual prender suol colui ch’a morte vada.
query.error: **English:** 127 when I heard, like something falling, 128 the mountain tremble; whereat a chill seized me 129 such as seizes him who goes to his death.
query.result: 127 pan glewas vy, kepar tra a gollas, 128 an meneth tevy, hag ena gorras vy 129 kepar henna a wra gorra an neb a wra dhe ves.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
130 Certo non si scoteo sì forte Delo, 131 pria che Latona in lei facesse ’l nido 132 a parturir li due occhi del cielo.
query.error: **English:** 130 Surely Delos did not shake so violently, 131 before Latona made her nest there 132 to give birth to the two eyes of heaven.
query.result: 130 Sur na scodhas vy ken Delo kemmys, 131 kyns Latona ynti a wrug gorra’y nyth 132 rag genys an dhewlagas a’n nev.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
133 Poi cominciò da tutte parti un grido 134 tal, che ’l maestro inverso me si feo, 135 dicendo: «Non dubbiar, mentr’ io ti guido».
query.error: **English:** 133 Then from every side a cry began, 134 such that my master turned to me, 135 saying: "Do not fear, while I guide you."
query.result: 133 Wosa henna, a-dro dhe bub tu, 134 an lef a wra dhe’n myghtern orth y’m, 135 ow leverel: “Na wra ofn, pan wra vy’m ow th’ysel.”

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
136 ‘Glorïa in excelsis’ tutti ‘Deo’ 137 dicean, per quel ch’io da’ vicin compresi, 138 onde intender lo grido si poteo.
query.error: **English:** 136 ‘Glory to God in the highest’ all 137 were saying, as I understood from those nearby, 138 whence the meaning of the cry could be understood.
query.result: 136 ‘Glori dhe’n Ughella’ oll ‘Deo’ 137 a leveris, avel orth y’m a gowsis, 138 orth henna an lef a wra aswonnys.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
139 No’ istavamo immobili e sospesi 140 come i pastor che prima udir quel canto, 141 fin che ’l tremar cessò ed el compiési.
query.error: **English:** 139 We stood there, motionless and suspended, 140 like shepherds who first hear that song, 141 until the trembling ceased and we moved on.
query.result: 139 Nyns omov ni sevel ha golowes, 140 kepar an bewon a glewas an gana, 141 bys na lemynas an kryjy ha mos mos.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
142 Poi ripigliammo nostro cammin santo, 143 guardando l’ombre che giacean per terra, 144 tornate già in su l’usato pianto.
query.error: **English:** 142 Then we resumed our holy journey, 143 looking at the shadows that lay on the ground, 144 now returned to their accustomed weeping.
query.result: 142 Wosa henna nyns kemer an fordh sans, 143 ow tos ow sel an skevens ow tos war an nor, 144 ow tos dyworth dhe'n gwella gwynn.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
145 Nulla ignoranza mai con tanta guerra 146 mi fé desideroso di sapere, 147 se la memoria mia in ciò non erra,
query.error: **English:** 145 Never did ignorance wage such war against me 146 with such a desire to know, 147 if my memory does not err in this,
query.result: 145 Nyns esa anvosoweth bythkweth par bell, 146 ow tos ow hwilli orth ydhyn, 147 mar nyns yw ow kov sodho,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
148 quanta pareami allor, pensando, avere; 149 né per la fretta dimandare er’ oso, 150 né per me lì potea cosa vedere:
query.error: **English:** 148 as it seemed to me then, as I thought about it; 149 but I did not dare to ask, because of my haste, 150 nor could I see anything there for myself:

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
151 così m’andava timido e pensoso.
query.error: **English:** 151 thus I went on, timid and thoughtful.
query.result: 151 kepar henna ow tos ow mos, owth ow kov sodho ha owth owthynkya.
